title: Figma Unveils Three AI-Powered Tools for Precise Image Editing: Erase, Isolate, and Expand

paragraphs.content: Figma launched three new AI-powered image editing tools—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—on December 10, 2025, enabling designers to make precise edits directly on the canvas without exporting to external software like Photoshop. These features integrate into a revamped image editing toolbar alongside existing options such as Crop and Remove background, streamlining workflows for marketers and creative teams. The tools prioritize granular control without requiring text prompts, addressing common pain points in refining visuals for UI mockups, campaigns, and product shots.

paragraphs.content: Independent testing highlights the tools' effectiveness for everyday tasks like UI designs and thumbnails, though they show limitations in complex scenarios compared to professional editors. Figma's release notes confirm the centralized toolbar rollout, making features like object selection and background adjustments more accessible. Hands-on reviews praise reduced dependency on Photoshop for simple edits, positioning these as practical advancements for in-house teams.

sections.title: Breakdown of Erase Object, Isolate Object, and Expand Image Capabilities

paragraphs.content: **Erase object** uses an improved lasso tool to select and remove unwanted elements from images, eliminating the need for external cleanup workflows. **Isolate object** separates a subject from its background, allowing repositioning or effects like blur, lighting, desaturation, shadow, color, or focus while preserving the original image characteristics. These canvas-based edits reduce friction for designers handling brand-consistent visuals and mockups.

paragraphs.content: **Expand image** extends backgrounds to new aspect ratios without distortion, ideal for adapting square product shots to landscape banners or desktop hero images to mobile formats. Figma's blog emphasizes how these tools complement generative AI like Nano Banana by focusing on precise, non-prompt-based manipulation. The consolidated toolbar now prominently features Remove background, reflecting its high usage among designers for scalable consistency.

sections.title: Workflow Gains and Competitive Positioning Against Adobe and Canva

paragraphs.content: The tools enable in-house edits without pinging design teams for routine tasks like background cleanups, speeding turnarounds for performance marketers and content creators. TechCrunch reports Figma catching up to rivals Adobe and Canva, which have offered object removal for years, with the launch coinciding with Adobe's similar ChatGPT integration. ContentGrip notes minimized platform-switching for contextual edits during cross-functional reviews.

Availability is limited to Full seat users on Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled in Figma Design and Draw, with expansion to more products planned for 2026. Figma positions these as part of a complete creative workflow, joining AI image generation for faster, intuitive precision. Industry coverage anticipates broader adoption as Figma builds toward a full-stack visual design hub.
